name: Filipino Mung Bean and Chicken Stew
description: This recipe captures the flavors of a classic Filipino dish with a hearty and nutritious blend of ingredients.

ingredients.ingredient: 2+ lbs boneless chicken thigh/breast, diced into half-inch cubes
1 bitter melon, halved, seeded, and sliced into semi-circle slices
4 cups mung beans, soaked in water overnight
1 tablespoon garlic powder or minced garlic

instructions: Soak 4 cups of mung beans in water overnight.
In a 4+ quart deep frying pan or wok, heat 2/3 cup olive oil over medium heat.
Add the diced tomato and diced onion to the pan, stirring until they soften.
Add 1 tablespoon of garlic powder or minced garlic and stir.
Add 2 cups of drained mung beans to the pan and stir.
Add 1 tablespoon of fish sauce (patis) and stir well.
Add half of the diced chicken and continue to stir.
Add half of the sliced bitter melon and stir to combine.
Add the remaining 2 cups of drained mung beans and the remaining diced chicken, stirring continuously.
Add the remaining bitter melon slices and stir to mix everything well.
Reduce heat to medium-low and cook uncovered for 20 minutes, stirring occasionally. If too much liquid evaporates, add a cup of chicken broth or add broth to taste to maintain a desired consistency.
Serve the mung bean and chicken mixture over steamed rice. Enjoy!
